name: Gaylord Opryland Resort & Convention Center

reviews.text: I went here for a business convention. It was a beautiful hotel and well run. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful. There were a couple of conventions going on at the same time and they handled it well. The room was clean and comfortable. We had a balcony which was a real bonus. I LOVE the fact that it's non-smoking. I wish they would eliminate the smoking outside under the canopies and at the pool as well. The restaurants have very good food, but are extremely expensive. Be prepared. It's also not located near anything else, so if you don't have a car, you'll need to purchase shuttle transportation to go into town. You would think that for the cost of the rooms, they would offer that at no cost, but they don't. The shuttles run every hour or half-hour, depending on the time of day, and the drivers are just as friendly and helpful as the hotel staff. They also charged $30 round trip for the airport shuttle, which I thought was excessive.
reviews.title: Great Place to Stay

reviews.text: We were with my sister who had a conference. This hotel is so massive if you have any issue walking you will never make it. Prepare to be lost at least a couple of times, even though the maps are helpful. The staff was EXCELLENT outside of one loud-mouthed female valet. The place was immaculate. The air conditioner froze us!! The bathroom door opened a little funny, right onto an outside vanity. We got extra balnkets and towels within a reasonable time. Room service pizza was great. The only complaint is there is not enough 'fast food' within the hotel. STAX was FULL at lunch and to navigate to another resturant was not possible with only 45 min for lunch. Plenty of neat shopping, need more snack places beside the one ice cream shop. Lots of places to just sit around and people watch and have a drink. Would go back in a minute.
reviews.title: Massive Beautiful Hotel!!!

reviews.text: Beautiful, jaw-dropping, larger than life resort. Gorgeous gardens, waterfalls, delicious restaurants and tons of activities all year round! I highly recommend this for every age group!
reviews.title: Amazing and beautiful!

reviews.text: I was on at a business conference here and just returned a couple of days ago. This is a fantastic hotel that exceeded my expectations. The hotel staff was extremely friendly and very helpful. Food and service was great!
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel - Fantastic Service

reviews.text: Even though I live in Nashville, I recently spent 2 nights at the hotel for a "girls getaway" weekend and a great time was had by all! We booked massages and manicures/pedicures at the spa - which was fantastic. From the moment we walked in we were treated like royalty. Receptionist was wonderful. We were escorted to the dressing room where we relaxed in the sauna and steam room. It was clean and comfortable and was equipped with every product you could ever need. It really was truly great experience. We enjoyed strolling around the hotel and shops, restaurants were excellent. We even spent time lounging at not one, but two pools! I'd like a quarterly reservation! I'm definitely planning on a return visit!
reviews.title: Queen for a weekend!
Way overpriced
reviews.text: Visited the Gaylord Opryland Hotel during August 2004. The hotel is way overpriced for the type of room you get. I have had better rooms at the Best Westerns. Bathroom was small and hairdryer didn't work very good at all. Nothing special at all about the room. No refrigerator! The cleaning was horrible - no toilet paper, shampoo, etc. restocked. We had to go in search of the maid to get these items two days in a row.

reviews.title: I agree it's over rated
reviews.text: The interior is pretty, but again way overpriced. The boat trip even costs hotel guest $8 to take it.

reviews.title: You need to relax and enjoy this beautiful hotel
reviews.text: Parking is the absolute worst of anywhere I've been. You almost have to valet park at $17.50 per day since they make it very inconvenient to self park and that is $8.50 per day.

reviews.title: Beautiful Grounds-Not-so-hot hotel rooms
reviews.text: The only friendly staff were the valet parkers - they were really nice, but then again, you were tipping them everytime you picked up your car.

reviews.title: An expensive dump
reviews.text: Never stay there again!!!

Walk for miles, get nowhere, rude employees, over priced restaurants, a huge medical meeting on the property and the restaurant near the front was closed, the bar closed for a private party. When I learn a meeting is at a Gaylord, I look for somewhere else to stay, or not attend.
reviews.title: of all of the Gaylord properties, my least favorite

reviews.text: Expect to have fun; go to the Grand Ole Opry; shop; eat; ride the riverboat; just experience as much as possible; there's so much to see and do here; it's just beautiful and kept so spotless!!!
reviews.title: Awesome place to stay; we would absolutely stay here again and again....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very nice hotel with all the amenities one would expect from a 5 star "resort" property. The hotel is large, very large with a convention center, three atriums, spa, pool, water falls, plants, trees and foilage, river "inside" the hotel with boat, shops, restaurants, great communication with everyone and finally, beautiful glass roof to maintain the perfect weather inside! Seriously, we had a wonderful time at this resort (mid August 2011) and have absolutely no complaints! It is pricey, but as the old saying goes "you get what you pay for" and they definitely lived up to that standard with us. PS - the beds and showers are excellent! Go...have a good time!
reviews.title: Awesome Hotel!

reviews.text: Accommodations were great. Besides the conference catered meals, ate at the Jack Daniel's Bar, and the food was delectable. Would definitely go back again.
reviews.title: Awesome place

reviews.text: Wow, put your walking shoes on. A beautiful experience, could spend days here, even without business. Spent 5 nights on business with an on-site convention, attending meetings and exhibits. Most meal supplied, but when not, it was harder to find suitable options that were not exhorbitantly priced for a meal or snack. Buy a scavenger hunt and search for the listed landmarks to help learn your way around the facility for easier navigation during your stay- and it was fun! Hard to remember I was not really *outside* when entering any of the atriums. Evening music functions in atrium did not disrupt sleeping rooms. Their Get Green environmental initiative could use some help as I could not successfully get them to NOT service my room during my stay; on site recycling program very minimal. Bring your family, they will get lost without you!
reviews.title: Schedule yourself extra time here to take advantage around business
opryland hotel
reviews.text: our first trip to nashville, tn was absolutely great!! we stayed at the gaylord opryland hotel - which i would absolutely reccommend - although the food/drink was a little pricey it is a great atmosphere - the rooms were clean, staff was polite, we'll definitely go back

reviews.title: Nice but overpriced
reviews.text: Let me start out by saying that the Gardens, Atriums, and fountains were beautiful. The rooms were pretty nice too, coffee maker, and free USA today newspaper. Other than that the rooms were average. The food was good too.

I felt that for a hotel that centers itself around conferences they need to get up to date technology wise. I was disappointed to find that the rooms did not have high speed internet access to plug in a laptop. On the TV you could pay $5 for 20 minutes at dial up speed. Or you could go to the "Internet Cafe" Contrary to the name there isn't a "Cafe". The computer room has only 4 thin client computers for the entire hotel conference complex. The computers are stripped down so that you can only have one internet window open. Plus there are always at least 2 people standing behind you waiting to get on the internet.
reviews.title: Loved the Opryland Resort
wonderful
reviews.text: I also felt that to pay $8 per day for parking when you are shoveling over $150 a night is rediculous too. One secret for free parking, you can park in the back of the Opry Mills mall parking lot (section 6B) and take a short scenic walk to the hotel for free.

reviews.title: We'll be back next year!
reviews.text: This place is certainly a tourist trap, they find ways to nickle and dime you all over, plus Nashville must have a sales tax rate of almost 10%, so stuff might seem cheap in stores or on menu's until you get the bill. They also have a Norman-Rockwell exibit, the price $15 per person. I went to the actual Norman-Rockwell museum in Massachusets, I think it was only $5-10 to get in there.

This was like 5 hotels in one with multiple restaurants & bars. Standard room was nice & clean. Nice pools, hot tub & exercise facility as well. I was there for a convention and the conference center was also nice & well-run. I would definitely go & stay here again. The only downside is cost of the restaurants & bar drinks. Still not bad for a resort of this caliber.
reviews.title: Amazingcomplex

reviews.text: My company paid for my room but they asked me for my personal credit card to put up for incidentals.well a long story short they charged my card for a 3 day stay.in my book that's called FRAUD.so I guess they charged my company and me for the 3 day stay.I'm very displeased with the service at the front desk also.the woman in charge was no help and acted like it was a hassle for her to try to make this situation right.will not recommend this hotel to anyone as a matter of fact I'm going to go out my way to let people know how i was treated and hopefully they won't be scammed as I was.
reviews.title: Fraud scam awful stay

reviews.text: Not at all what we expected. Upon arrival our room had a dirty paper tissue on the floor in plain site. After our first night and the cleaning staff "cleaned" our room the dirty tissue still remained in plain site. The carpet had stains everywhere and the mini fridge did not work. I will try to post pictures of the nice stains. Hidden fees such as a $10 resort fee per day, $18.95 parking fee per day were not mentioned to me even after I asked the clerk at check in about our room rate. Plan on spending theme park prices on food and beverages. We had hamburgers, fries and a soft drink for $11.50 each, $4.00 for a cup of coffee. The staff also was not very friendly. They seemed to look as if they wish they were somewhere else. I can't blame them.
reviews.title: BEWARE! HIDDEN COST!

reviews.text: We attended a conference for 5000 people. Not only was the this hotel stunning from its indoor waterfalls, indoor boat tour, and jungle garden with incredible orchides, but the service was beyond the norm. For the five days that we were there there was never a repeat in the the snacks, breakfast, or lunches that we were served. The staff was always smiling nad accomodating with our needs. I can't wait to take my family there for a non business trip!
reviews.title: Amazing place to stay

reviews.text: The Gaylord-Nashville was my first stay at one of these types of hotels. I came for a convention. I also hadroom reservations here. I was unaware that the hotel was so massive, I should have packed walking shoes. The Convention Center was on the other side of the hotel and the rooms for the sessions were all over the hotel. My feet still hurt 3 days later. The hotel is definitely beautiful and all of the employees were really nice. My room was really clean and comfortable.
reviews.title: Nice Stay but need walking shoes
Over priced
reviews.text: Stayed at the Gaylord, I thought it was beautiful. The atrium was great. Lots of walking. but I could use it, the waterfalls were wonderful and with the beauty all around you didn't mind the walk, as long as you weren't trying to hurry to a meeting. I walked out by the pool one night and was amazed by the fireflys (I held my hand out and they landed on my hand). OVER PRICED. The rooms weren't great and at over $200 a night, pricey.
Date of stay, 9th of september to 13th september.
reviews.title: A superb experience

reviews.text: The Gaylord hotel is truly beautiful, my wife and I are 5* hotel people, we really do love the best of hotels. This hotel lived up to all expectations. The room was very good with everything you would expect. but it was the atriums, and the waterfalls, the river, and the whole ambience that thrilled us. we would reccomend this hotel to anyone with imagination. The resturaunts were excellent especially the "old hickory steakhouse" the best meal we`ve had in ages. Of course the prices match the hotel, we expected and accepted that, and we felt that we got value for money, and enjoyed every minute of the experience.
reviews.title: Nice Gardens, So-So Rooms
Very nice!
reviews.text: I recently stayed here for a convention. The grounds are beautiful--especially the gardens inside. There's nothing like it anywhere else I know of. To get to my room, I had to walk through the gardens so I expected to be "wowed" when I opened the door to my room. Not so. The room was average at best. I was supposed to have a king room, but got two doubles. Rather than hike back down to the check-in desk, I decided just to make do. The room was small and the furniture was old. The bathroom was also tiny and the shower felt like it had been placed into the wall in one whole piece--very weird. I'm only 5 feet tall and I felt a little cramped. The bed was not exceptionally comfortable (having just stayed at the Marriott World Center in Orlando, I had something to compare it to and I must say the Marriott far surpassed the Opryland Resort at a significantly lower price). The restaurants do have good food and the staff is very friendly. But I really did think that $229 per night was too much for the room. When I checked in I asked about upgrading to a premium view and was told it would be an extra $40 per night. However, when I looked online that same day it showed a rate of $229 for premium view....hmmmm. Room service was mediocre as far as selection--I usually order from room service when traveling on my own, but not this time. The desk was not very conducive to working, so business travelers beware--the Courtyard Marriott hotels are much better in this regard. This seemed odd considering it's a convention hotel. Anyway, overall it was a nice stay, but I got tired of having to walk miles to get from my room to the convention, to restaurants and back!

Stayed here for 2 nights earlier this week for a conference. The grounds are beautiful, you feel outside but it's all inside a huge dome. Prepare for lots of walking. The place is huge and Cascades to Magnolia is quite a jaunt. Rooms were nothing special (2 sink set up is nice) and the carpets need cleaning, but overall above average. Overpriced at $200/night.
reviews.title: eye popping

reviews.text: This place is huge! I spent a week here for a convention and it took about two full days before I figured my way around this hotel. After checking in, I decided to take advantage of what would become my only opportunity to relax by the pool. My coworker decided to tour the Grand Old Opry. When she and I were texting back and forth to meet up, she went to the wrong pool. Not unexpected.
reviews.title: Need GPS to get around...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The availability of dining options is great. The food and drinks and service were universally excellent. Someone said that the staff's bonus as a whole depends on the number of favorable reviews they receive as a group so they help out each other. This is very evident --- they work together and are guest focused. Housekeeping staff were also great. For once, they didn't change my towels that I had hanging up --- I hate it when hotels have the tent cards that say they won't but do anyway.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel, but very expensive
Beautiful Hotel
reviews.text: The convention center was also good. But, it was spread out. So, when walking in heels, that's a lot of walking. My feet hurt by the third day.

The room I had was nice. It included a balcony overlooking the Delta atrium. One king-sized bed with many pillows. The bathroom included two sinks, one inside and one outside the bathroom proper. A refrigerator allows storage of drinks and snacks. Two bottles of water are included daily in the resort fee along with internet access.
reviews.title: This is how you run a hotel and conference!
Loved it
reviews.text: The main criticisms of the resort are that it's expensive. A simple lunch for two cost $60! Also, the vending machines do not carry food at all --- so, late night munchies are limited to the room service menu or (if one thought ahead -- hoarded snacks). Lastly, and to some, most importantly, the resort is not near the city center. A cab ride into town or to the airport is $25. There is a bus ($15 round trip -- but, service ends at 11 p.m.).

reviews.title: Awesome
reviews.text: What a visual experience! We couldn't have been more pleased with the hotel. The staff was very friendly, especially the wait staff. The plantings rival any I have seen at our conservatory in Chicago. We were very impressed with the cleanliness of our King room. The bath products, especially the oatmeal soap, were luxurious. We ate at the Cascades restaurant each morning, and the buffet for $12.95 included most anything you could want for breakfast. We then only needed a snack for lunch. The Opry Mills Mall also afforded many dining options if you didn't want to eat at the upscale restaurants in the hotel. Special thanks to the airport bus driver who went out of his way to take us to the Grand Ole Opry on a cold evening. We will definitely return to this hotel for the Opry's 80th birthday bash next year.

reviews.title: Spectacular, Strange with Mediocre service
reviews.text: The public areas of this hotel are impressive, but poorly planned. Gaylord has obviously invested a great deal of money in the properties public areas but often to very little advantage. There is a spectacular fountain show in the Delta area that is difficult to see and reach and would be a fantastic overlook from a restaurant.

reviews.title: Love-Hate Relationship
reviews.text: They have a shopping areas but some of the shops don't open until noon and others close quite early, like when we returned from the early Opry show at 8:30. It might not be peak shopping hours but it would do wonders for the atmosphere on the "Delta Island" and help in diminishing the impression that the shops are really only there for the busloads of tourists that are passing through each day.

reviews.title: The hotel provided a wonderful Honeymoon experience for 2 mature adults
reviews.text: There is NOT an indoor pool so keep this in mind if you're bringing the kids in the cooler months. (Sept-April)

reviews.title: Great Hotel
reviews.text: The rooms are small and of a Courtyard/Residence Inn quality. Not bad, but not worth going if you're expecting a luxury experience. If you are booking a room overlooking the atrium, which I would recommend, beware that there is definitely noise spillover from the bars. We got an earful from the Jack Daniels saloon our first night and early into the next morning. Other sections have live music, so keep this in mind if you or your children keep early hours.

description: Gaylord Opryland Resort & Convention Center, located at 2800 Opryland Drive in Nashville, Tenn., is the flagship property of Gaylord Hotels and is part of the Marriott portfolio of brands. The newly-renovated resort features 2,881 rooms and more than 600,000 square feet of meeting, convention and exhibit space. The property is best known for its signature glass roofs and nine acres of lavish indoor gardens and waterfalls.
